intro: Pentaplaris doroteae, commonly known as the Dorotea's pentaplaris, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Costa Rica. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in the late afternoon. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth surface with a slightly glossy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
